summary: This bill, the SAFE Sunscreen Standards Act, amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to improve the regulatory review process for nonprescription drugs intended for topical administration, with a focus on sunscreens. It directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to utilize real-world evidence and non-animal testing methods, and account for historical data when reviewing sunscreen active ingredients. The bill also mandates reporting to Congress on the implementation of these standards and progress in alternative testing methods.
